Authors:
Leticia Montoya, Mariana Herrera, Victor M. Bandala, Antero
Ramos
Title:
Two new species and a new record of yellow Cantharellus from
tropical Quercus forests in eastern Mexico with the proposal of a new
name for the replacement of Craterellus confluens
Keywords:
American cantharelles, Craterellus, ectomycorrhizal
mushrooms, oak, Neotropical cantharelles, wild edible mushrooms
Abstract:
Two new species of yellow cantharelles and a new record of
Cantharellus tabernensis associated with tropical species of Quercus are
presented, based on the taxonomic study of fresh specimens and in a
phylogenetic analysis of transcription elongation factor 1-alpha
(tef-1Î±) and the large subunit of the ribosome (nLSU) sequences. One of
the new species proposed here, corresponds to a choice edible mushroom,
it in our molecular phylogeny resulted to be related with the group of
species around C. lateritius and sister with Craterellus confluens type
specimen. This latter is here formally transferred to Cantharellus and
consequently a new name is proposed to replace the homonym Cantharellus
confluens (Schwein.) Schwein. 1834 a later synonym of Byssomerulius
corium. Detailed macroscopic and microscopic descriptions accompanied
with illustrations and a taxonomic discussion are presented for each
species.
